title: Why personal hygiene matters
body: People carry microbes on skin, hair and clothing. Good hygiene stops them reaching food. This is daily risk control, not a one-off tick box.

title: Six steps of effective handwashing
caption: Wet, soap, rub palms, backs, between fingers, rinse and dry.

prompt: Tap the steps in the correct order.

title: When to wash hands
body: Before starting work. After the toilet. After handling raw food or waste. After touching phone or face. After cleaning. After breaks. Before handling ready-to-eat food.

prompt: Find the contamination touchpoints on this workstation.

title: Clothing and PPE
body: Wear clean workwear daily. No outdoor coats in prep areas. Use hair restraints. Wear blue plasters and finger cots over cuts. Gloves are single-task items. Change when switching tasks. Aprons off for toilet and bins.

title: Illness and exclusion
stem: You developed diarrhoea yesterday evening. You feel OK this morning and you are on the rota for lunch.

options.label: Go to work and be careful
options.result: Wrong. You must not work with open food when symptomatic.

options.label: Report to manager and stay off for 48 hours after last symptom
options.result: Correct. Exclusion protects customers and staff.

title: Gloves vs clean hands
body: Gloves are not magic. Dirty gloves spread contamination exactly like dirty hands. Use gloves for specific tasks like ready-to-eat sandwiches. Change and wash hands between tasks.

bullets: Handwash with the full six steps
Wash at the right times, not just at start of shift
Keep clothing and PPE clean and task-specific
Report sickness and follow the 48-hour rule
